headline: Trump-endorsed Morgan Ortagus announces Tennessee run for Congress
author: Christopher Hutton
sentences: Ortagus emphasized her time working with the Trump administration, specifically her working closely with the State Department on the Abraham Accords, as well as organizing "coordinated messaging campaigns and responses to sensitive and high-profile foreign policy actions."

"As a U.S. Navy Reserve officer, I am answering the call to service, and I will never back down from fighting for my country and the good people of Tennessee to stand for American greatness," Ortagus said in her campaign announcement.

Ortagus's current competition in the GOP primary includes former music video director and conservative influencer Robby Starbuck, Nashville businessman Quincy McKnight, and local businesswoman Natisha Wright.
Ortagus, who previously served as a spokeswoman for the State Department during the Trump administration, announced on Monday that she would run to represent Tennessee's 5th District.
The 5th District, which was once a predominantly Democratic area, was heavily redistricted, to the point of forcing current Rep. Jim Cooper to retire.
Trump's endorsement of Ortagus over Starbuck created some tension among some of the more pro-Trump members of Congress.
Rep. Madison Cawthorn and Sen. Rand Paul endorsed Starbuck before Trump and pressed back on Trump's endorsement.
Ortagus went on to join Rubicon Founders, a healthcare investment firm in early 2021, reported the Tennessean.
Trump endorsed Ortagus on Jan. 25, declaring her an "absolute warrior for America First and MAGA."
Former State Department spokeswoman Morgan Ortagus announced her campaign for Congress.
Ortagus also flaunted her endorsement from former President Donald Trump.
